content:
Diagnosis:	Papillary thyroid carcinoma

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Total thyroidectomy and central neck dissection

Histology:	Classical variant papillary thyroid carcinoma, 2.8cm, no extrathyroidal extension
	pT2N0M0, RET fusion positive

Current Situation:	Post-radioiodine ablation review

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of radioiodine ablation therapy on 15 March 2024. The treatment was well tolerated with only mild symptoms of radiation thyroiditis which have now completely resolved. Her thyroglobulin level has appropriately decreased from 4.2 to 0.8 ng/mL post ablation, and thyroid stimulating hormone is well-suppressed at 0.1 mU/L on levothyroxine 150mcg daily.

The whole body scan performed one week after radioiodine treatment showed good uptake in the thyroid bed with no evidence of distant metastatic disease. The surgical site has healed well with no complications, and her voice remains normal with no evidence of recurrent laryngeal nerve dysfunction.

I have discussed these results with [redacted name] who is understandably pleased with her progress. Given her RET fusion positive status, we have arranged molecular tumor board review to discuss the potential role of selective RET inhibitor therapy, though this may not be required given her excellent response to standard treatment.

The plan is to continue with TSH suppression and monitor thyroglobulin levels every 3 months. We will arrange a follow-up neck ultrasound in 6 months' time. I will review her again in clinic with these results.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Classical variant papillary thyroid carcinoma, 2.8cm, no extrathyroidal extension

cancer_timeline.value: Total thyroidectomy and central neck dissection
Thyroglobulin decreased from 4.2 to 0.8 ng/mL post ablation
Whole body scan showed good uptake in thyroid bed with no evidence of distant metastatic disease

patient_facts.value: TSH well-suppressed at 0.1 mU/L on levothyroxine 150mcg daily
Surgical site healed well with normal voice and no recurrent laryngeal nerve dysfunction

status_updates.value: Early stage papillary thyroid cancer post surgery and radioiodine ablation with excellent response to treatment
Good response to radioiodine ablation with appropriate decrease in thyroglobulin levels
Continuing TSH suppression with levothyroxine 150mcg daily
Follow-up neck ultrasound in 6 months with thyroglobulin monitoring every 3 months
Review in clinic with ultrasound and thyroglobulin results
